SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.jcrom.dao
Interface JcrDAO<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractJcrDAO
public interface JcrDAO<T>

The base interface for JCR Data Access Objects. Normally, the interface will be implemented for each root object being mapped to a Java Content Repository (JCR). It is intended that such implementations will manage the JCR root path for the entity being mapped. JCR session strategy is also to be declared by implementations.

Implementations should encapsulate exceptions in JcrMappingException, which is a RuntimeException.

Author:
Olafur Gauti Gudmundsson, Nicolas Dos Santos

Method Detail

create

T create(T entity)
Creates a new JCR Node from the object supplied. The path to the parent node will be retrieved from the entity path. A path of "/" means that the entity will be created on root level.

Parameters:
entity - the object to be mapped to a JCR node
Returns:
the newly created Object

create

T create(T entity,
         JcromCallback action)
Creates a new JCR Node from the object supplied. The path to the parent node will be retrieved from the entity path. A path of "/" means that the entity will be created on root level.

Parameters:
entity - the object to be mapped to a JCR node
action - callback object that specifies the Jcrom actions:
  • JcromCallback.doAddNode(Node, String, JcrNode, Object),
  • JcromCallback.doAddMixinTypes(Node, String[], JcrNode, Object),
  • JcromCallback.doAddClassNameToProperty(Node, JcrNode, Object),
  • JcromCallback.doComplete(Object, Node),
Returns:
the newly created Object

create

         T entity)
Creates a new JCR Node from the object supplied, under the parent node with the path specified.

Parameters:
parentNodePath - path to the parent node
entity - the object to be mapped to a JCR node
Returns:
the newly created Object

         T entity,
         JcromCallback action)
Creates a new JCR Node from the object supplied, under the parent node with the path specified.

Parameters:
parentNodePath - path to the parent node
entity - the object to be mapped to a JCR node
action - callback object that specifies the Jcrom actions:
  • JcromCallback.doAddNode(Node, String, JcrNode, Object),
  • JcromCallback.doAddMixinTypes(Node, String[], JcrNode, Object),
  • JcromCallback.doAddClassNameToProperty(Node, JcrNode, Object),

update

T update(T entity,
         JcromCallback action)
Updates an existing JCR Node with the values extracted from the object supplied.

Parameters:
entity - the object to be mapped to a JCR node
action - callback object that specifies the Jcrom actions:
  • JcromCallback.doUpdateClassNameToProperty(Node, JcrNode, Object),
  • JcromCallback.doMoveNode(Node, Node, String, JcrNode, Object),
  • JcromCallback.doComplete(Object, Node),
Returns:
the updated Object
Since:
2.1.0

update

@Deprecated
T update(T entity,
                    String childNameFilter,
                    int maxDepth)
Deprecated. This method is now deprecated. Use update(Object, NodeFilter) instead.

Updates an existing JCR Node with the values extracted from the object supplied.

Parameters:
entity - the object to be mapped to a JCR node
childNameFilter - comma separated list of names of child nodes to load ("*" loads all, "none" loads no children, and "-" at the beginning makes it an exclusion filter)
maxDepth - the maximum depth of loaded child nodes (0 means no child nodes are loaded, while a negative value means that no restrictions are set on the depth).
Returns:
the updated Object

update

T update(T entity,
         NodeFilter nodeFilter)
Update an existing JCR node with the entity supplied.

Parameters:
entity - the entity that will be mapped to the existing node
nodeFilter - the NodeFilter to apply when updating child nodes and references
Returns:
the updated Object
Since:
2.1.0

update

T update(T entity,
         NodeFilter nodeFilter,
         JcromCallback action)
Update an existing JCR node with the entity supplied.

Parameters:
entity - the entity that will be mapped to the existing node
nodeFilter - the NodeFilter to apply when updating child nodes and references
action - callback object that specifies the Jcrom actions:
  • JcromCallback.doUpdateClassNameToProperty(Node, JcrNode, Object),
  • JcromCallback.doMoveNode(Node, Node, String, JcrNode, Object),
  • JcromCallback.doComplete(Object, Node),
Returns:
the updated Object

maxDepth - the maximum depth of loaded child nodes (0 means no child nodes are loaded, while a negative value means that no restrictions are set on the depth).

the updated Object

newParentPath -

get

T get(String path)
Get an entity from JCR by path (from a @JcrPath field).

Parameters:
path - the full path of the entity to be loaded
Returns:
an object instance mapped from the JCR node with the path supplied, or null if no such node was found

getAll

List<T> getAll(String path,
               long startIndex,
               long resultSize)
Get all entities from JCR by path (from a @JcrPath field). Takes parameters that control the size and offset of the result.

Parameters:
startIndex - the zero based index of the first item to return
resultSize - the number of items to return
Returns:
a list of object instances mapped from the JCR nodes with the path supplied, or null if no such node was found

getAll

@Deprecated
List<T> getAll(String path,
                          String childNameFilter,
                          int maxDepth,
                          long startIndex,
                          long resultSize)
Deprecated. This method is now deprecated. Use getAll(String, NodeFilter, long, long) instead.

Get all entities from JCR by path (from a @JcrPath field). Takes parameters that control the size and offset of the result, and filter which child nodes to load.

Parameters:
path - the full path of the entities to be loaded
childNameFilter - comma separated list of names of child nodes to load ("*" loads all, "none" loads no children, and "-" at the beginning makes it an exclusion filter)
maxDepth - the maximum depth of loaded child nodes (0 means no child nodes are loaded, while a negative value means that no restrictions are set on the depth).
startIndex - the zero based index of the first item to return
resultSize - the number of items to return
Returns:
a list of object instances mapped from the JCR nodes with the path supplied, or null if no such node was found

Parameters:

a list of object instances mapped from the JCR nodes with the path supplied, or null if no such node was found

                    String versionName,
                    boolean removeExisting)
Restore a specific version by path and version name.

Parameters:
path - the full path of the entity to be loaded
versionName - a version name
removeExisting - a boolean flag that governs what happens in case of an identifier collision.

                long startIndex,

findAll

@Deprecated
List<T> findAll(String rootPath,
                           String childNameFilter,
                           int maxDepth)
Deprecated. This method is now deprecated. Use findAll(String, NodeFilter) instead.

Find all entities represented by this DAO.

Parameters:
rootPath - root path of the found entities
childNameFilter - comma separated list of names of child nodes to load ("*" loads all, "none" loads no children, and "-" at the beginning makes it an exclusion filter)
maxDepth - the maximum depth of loaded child nodes (0 means no child nodes are loaded, while a negative value means that no restrictions are set on the depth).
Returns:
all entities represented by this DAO

findAll

List<T> findAll(String rootPath,
                NodeFilter nodeFilter)
Find all entities represented by this DAO.

Parameters:
rootPath - root path of the found entities
nodeFilter - the NodeFilter to apply when loading child nodes and references
Returns:
all entities represented by this DAO
Since:
2.1.0

findAll

@Deprecated
List<T> findAll(String rootPath,
                           String childNameFilter,
                           int maxDepth,
                           long startIndex,
                           long resultSize)
Deprecated. This method is now deprecated. Use findAll(String, NodeFilter, long, long) instead.

Find all entities represented by this DAO. Takes parameters that control the size and offset of the result, and filter which child nodes to load.

Parameters:
rootPath - root path of the found entities
childNameFilter - comma separated list of names of child nodes to load ("*" loads all, "none" loads no children, and "-" at the beginning makes it an exclusion filter)
maxDepth - the maximum depth of loaded child nodes (0 means no child nodes are loaded, while a negative value means that no restrictions are set on the depth).
startIndex - the zero based index of the first item to return
resultSize - the number of items to return
Returns:
all entities represented by this DAO
